A: 1. Jesus taught us to pray without _ (a) ceasing (b) stopping (c) interruption
2. According to Jesus' teaching, we should pray to God in _ (a) public (b) secret (c) church
3. When we pray and the answer has not come, Jesus taught us not to get _ (a) tired (b) discouraged (c) angry
4. Jesus taught us to pray in faith without _ (a) doubt (b) fear (c) hesitation
5. When praying, Jesus encouraged us to pray for something _ (a) general (b) specific (c) anything
6. Jesus is the Son of _ (a) Man (b) God (c) David
7. Jesus has power over all things on _ (a) heaven (b) earth (c) sea
8. Jesus demonstrated His power over natural forces by calming the _ (a) river (b) lake (c) sea
9. When Jesus spoke to the wind, He said 'Peace be _' (a) still (b) calm (c) quiet
10. Another way Jesus demonstrated His power over natural forces was by walking on the _ (a) land (b) sea (c) mountain
11. How many people followed Jesus to the mountain before the feeding miracle? (a) two thousand (b) five thousand (c) ten thousand
12. How many loaves of bread did the boy have? (a) three (b) five (c) seven
13. How many small fishes did the boy have? (a) one (b) two (c) three
14. After feeding the five thousand, how many full baskets of leftovers were collected? (a) seven (b) ten (c) twelve
15. Which of these people did Jesus heal? (a) Jairus's Daughter (b) Peter's Mother-in-law (c) The widow's son
16. Which of these people did Jesus raised from the dead? (a) The paralysed man (b) Peter's Mother-in-law (c) Lazarus
17. The Memory Verse for this lesson is from Luke _ (a) 5:16 (b) 7:16 (c) 9:16
18. According to the Memory Verse, a great _ is risen up among us (a) king (b) prophet (c) leader
19. Jesus performed a lot of _ on earth (a) tricks (b) miracles (c) shows
20. Jesus helped so many people with His _ (a) words (b) power (c) presence
B: 2. Name one way Jesus demonstrated His power over natural forces.
3. How many people did Jesus feed with five loaves and two fishes?
4. Name one person whom Jesus healed.
5. Name one person whom Jesus raised from the dead.
C: 1. Discuss the significance of Jesus' teaching on praying without ceasing and praying in secret.
2. Explain how Jesus demonstrated His divine power over natural forces. Provide specific examples from the text.
3. Describe the miracle of feeding the five thousand. What key lessons can be learned from this event?
4. Summarize the different categories of miracles performed by Jesus as mentioned in the text.
5. What is the main message of the Memory Verse (Luke 7:16) and how does it relate to Jesus' actions described in the text?
answers_B: Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name; thy kingdom come; thy will be done; on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil. Amen.
Calming the sea OR Walking on the sea.
Peter's Mother-in-law OR The paralysed man.
Jairus's Daughter OR The widow's son OR Lazarus.
answers_C: Praying without ceasing emphasizes persistence and constant communion with God, showing reliance and dedication. Praying in secret highlights humility and sincerity, ensuring prayer is for God's attention, not human praise.

Jesus demonstrated divine power by commanding elements. Examples include calming a great storm at sea by saying 'Peace be still,' which immediately stopped the wind, and walking on the surface of the sea, defying natural laws.

Jesus fed five thousand people with only five loaves and two fish. He took the meager resources, prayed, and distributed them through His disciples, resulting in everyone being satisfied and twelve baskets of leftovers. Lessons include Jesus' compassion, His ability to multiply and provide abundantly from little, and the importance of sharing.

The text mentions Jesus' power over natural forces (calming the sea, walking on the sea), His power over diseases (healing Peter's Mother-in-law, the paralysed man), and His power over death (raising Jairus's Daughter, the widow's son, and Lazarus).

The main message is that a great prophet has risen, and God has visited His people. This relates to Jesus' actions by affirming that His miracles (healing, raising the dead, controlling nature) are evidence of Him being that great prophet and God's divine presence and intervention among humanity.
